content:
Knut's Viking background likely had an impact on his relationship with the Anglo-Saxon people of England, in addition to his Christian beliefs. When Knut first came to power in England, he was initially viewed with suspicion by some Anglo-Saxons due to his foreign heritage. However, over time, Knut was able to win over the support of many Anglo-Saxons through his policies of good governance and religious reform.

Knut's Viking background may have initially made him seem like an outsider to the Anglo-Saxons, but it also gave him a unique perspective and understanding of the cultural and economic ties between England and the Scandinavian countries. As a result, he was able to forge alliances with other Viking rulers and bring a measure of peace and stability to the region. 

Overall, while Knut's Christian beliefs likely played a role in his relationship with the Anglo-Saxon people of England, his Viking background also helped to shape his policies and approach to governance.
